content:
Long-read Rare Disease - Diagnostic Whole Genome Sequencing

Specialized pipeline for identifying disease-causing genetic variants in rare disease patients using long-read sequencing technologies (PacBio HiFi, Oxford Nanopore). Unlike short-read sequencing, long reads excel at detecting structural variants, repeat expansions, and complex genomic rearrangements that are frequently responsible for rare diseases.

What is Long-read Rare Disease Analysis?

Long-read sequencing generates DNA reads spanning 10,000-100,000+ base pairs, enabling comprehensive detection of structural variants (SVs), tandem repeat expansions, and copy number variations (CNVs) that cause many neurodevelopmental disorders and rare genetic diseases.

Key Features

  • Structural Variant Detection: Identifies deletions, duplications, inversions, translocations > 50bp
  • Repeat Expansion Analysis: Detects pathogenic tandem repeat expansions in disease-associated loci
  • Complete Haplotype Phasing: Resolves compound heterozygosity and inheritance patterns
  • Complex Region Resolution: Sequences through low-complexity and repetitive genomic regions
  • CNV Calling: Accurate copy number variant identification across genome
  • Small Variant Detection: SNVs and indels with high accuracy (>99.9% for HiFi)

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Quality Control: Assess read length, quality scores, and coverage distribution
  2. Read Alignment: Map long reads to reference genome with specialized aligners
  3. Structural Variant Calling: Identify SVs using multiple complementary callers
  4. Repeat Expansion Detection: Screen known disease-associated repeat loci
  5. SNV/Indel Calling: Call small variants with long-read-specific tools
  6. Haplotype Phasing: Phase variants into maternal/paternal chromosomes
  7. Annotation: Annotate variants with clinical databases (ClinVar, OMIM, HGMD)
  8. Prioritization: Rank variants by pathogenicity and disease relevance

Scientific Applications

  • Neurodevelopmental Disorders: Autism, intellectual disability, epilepsy
  • Repeat Expansion Diseases: Fragile X, Huntington's, myotonic dystrophy, spinocerebellar ataxias
  • Structural Variant Disorders: Genomic deletion/duplication syndromes
  • Undiagnosed Disease Programs: Cases unsolved by short-read sequencing
  • Complex Locus Analysis: HLA typing, pharmacogenomics (CYP2D6), SMN1/SMN2
  • De Novo Mutation Discovery: Sporadic cases with no family history

Advantages Over Short-read Sequencing

  • Better SV Detection: 10-100x more sensitive for structural variants > 50bp
  • Repeat Expansion Calling: Can sequence through tandem repeats impossible for short reads
  • Complete Phasing: Phase entire chromosomes without family trios
  • Mappability: Resolves 99% of genome including difficult regions
  • Diagnostic Yield: 10-40% increased diagnostic rate in rare disease cohorts

Input Requirements

  • Long-read FASTQ/BAM: PacBio HiFi reads (Q20+) or Nanopore reads (Q10+)
  • Sample Sheet: CSV with sample information and read file locations
  • Reference Genome: GRCh38/hg38 with annotations
  • Optional: Parental samples for trio analysis and de novo variant detection

Main Outputs

  • Structural Variants: VCF files with deletions, duplications, inversions, translocations
  • Repeat Expansions: Identified pathogenic repeat expansions with exact sizes
  • SNV/Indel VCF: Small variants with genotype quality scores
  • Phased Variants: Haplotype-resolved variant calls
  • Clinical Report: Prioritized list of candidate pathogenic variants
  • QC Metrics: Coverage, read quality, variant calling statistics

Perfect for: Rare Disease Diagnostics • Neurodevelopmental Disorders • Structural Variant Detection • Repeat Expansion Diseases • Undiagnosed Cases • Complex Genomic Regions • Clinical Genomics
